lines.text: Who's that?
I'm Peter Panic from Never Nervous Land.
[Nana barks and scares him off, but he returns]
What's that?
That's my nice Nana, short for Banana.

[Curly Joe's sweeping a hole in the dirt]
What do you think you're doing, ya lame brain?
Just sweeping off the sidewalk.
There *isn't* any sidewalk, you numbskull!
There isn't? Whew, that's a relief.
[Moe grabs the broom and hits Curly Joe in the nose with it]
Now I know how Pinocchio felt.
The Martins and the Cuckoo Coys, I seem to remember those names.
You're doing good if you can remember your own name, you knucklehead.
Well it's not my fault, I was a kindergarten dropout.

[Larry gets blown out of a chimney and opens his umbrella]
Mary Poppins, fancy meeting you here.
That's not funny.
Take the wheel.
Okay.
[Curly Joe mistakes Moe's words and takes out the steering wheel, steering wheel column and all]
I got it
Stupid, put that back in the car!
[Hits Curly Joe]

[muttering]
Why can't you make up your mind?
Where have you been, Chowderhead?

[hypnotized]
In the oven, in the oven.

[a head bust of Napolean blows dirt in Curly Joe's face]
Now Nappy, was that nice? And you used to be one of my favorite generals! You're going to get in trouble for that, buddy boy.

[trying to invent a flying bicycle]
If this works, we can call it a blimp-cicle.
And if it doesn't work, you'll get a bop-cicle.
[repeated line]
Boy you really know how to hurt a guy.
You don't know anything about cars.

What do you mean I don't know anything about cars? You mean I know everything about cars. I know this, if the carberator doesn't carb and the differentiator is different, and the distributor's cap doesn't distribute, and the crankcase gets cranky, that car will not run.

[Moe's mouth is stuck shut from glue on his pancakes instead of syrup]
Are you mad, Moe?
[Moe growls]
No he's not mad.
[Moe growls]
He's not mad, he's not saying anything.
Will say something, Moe.
I'll murder you!

[on a motorscooter in the middle of a chase between police and a robber]
You know something, Moe?
What?
We're not going to get out of this alive.
That's what I like about you, always optimistic.
Boy it's not easy to get a diploma for dentistry. Three whole weeks I have to study! By mail!
Wait a minute, and that's just a license to practice dentistry!
Oh I'll get my practice alright. Curly-Joe, you be my nurse.
And a very pretty one, too...
And YOU be my patient.
No way. You're not gonna practice on me, Moe. Absolutely, positively, *NO!*
[Re-enters with Curly-Joe dressed as a woman pushing him into the dentist office]
Can't we talk this over?

[the Stooges are fighting a mechanical bandit in the old west. The bandit shoots a plunger, which sticks to Curly's face]
Boy is he tricky.
[Bandit shoots plunger into Moe's face]
And mean.

[Bandit shoots plunger into Larry's face]
That's a clever obstruction.

[Curly and Larry are in a desert digging for treasure while Moe watches]
Would you two hurry up it's hot up here in the sun!
Well do you think it's ice cold down here?
Don't give me none of your backtalk! Keep diggin'!
Gee, Moe that's the first time you let anyone tell you where to get off.

[Moe is practicing dentistry on Larry]
Cotton! Cotton!
[Moe and Curly start forcing cotton into Larry's mouth]
Mmph! Mmmm!
Oh you can get more than that in.
[Continues stuffing Larry's mouth with cotton]
Nurse, please, administer anesthetic.
[Curly hits Larry with a mallet, knocking him out]
